item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jim Corbett
item.description: "Tigers, except when wounded or when man-eaters, are on the whole very good-tempered...Occassionally a tiger will object to too close an approach to its cubs or to a kill that it is guarding. The objection invariably takes the form of growling, and if this does not prove effective itis followed by short rushes accompanied by terrifying roars. If these warnings are disregarded, the blame for any injury inflicted rests entirely with the intruder"- Jim Corbett" -- Jim Corbett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Leslie Mass
item.description: "I resolve that I would not die with my dreams unlived." -- Leslie Mass

item.title: Michelle add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport; when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "The idea of wilderness needs no defense, it only needs defenders." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Stevie Ray Vaughan
item.description: "You see, we are here, as far as I can tell, to help each other; our brothers, our sisters, our friends, our enemies. That is to help each other and not hurt each other. " -- Stevie Ray Vaughan
